title: How to Make a Cola Cake

steps.headline: Spray the baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Combine the dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking soda) in a mixing bowl.
Mix the cola, margarine or butter, and cocoa in a saucepan.
Pour the liquid mixture over the flour mixture.
Beat the eggs and mix in.
steps.description: Add the milk, vanilla and marshmallows. The batter should be thin in consistency and the marshmallows will float to the surface.

steps.headline: Bake the cake for 35 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Make the frosting before the cake cools.
Mix the cola, cocoa, and margarine or butter in a pan and bring to a boil.
Add the vanilla and powdered sugar.
Spread the warm frosting on the cake.
Sprinkle chopped nuts over cake, if desired.
steps.description: Once the frosting has set, the cake is ready to serve.

text: Making the Cake Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Spray the baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.  Combine the dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking soda) in a mixing bowl.  Mix the cola, margarine or butter, and cocoa in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Pour the liquid mixture over the flour mixture. Mix well. Beat the eggs and mix in. Add the milk, vanilla and marshmallows. The batter should be thin in consistency and the marshmallows will float to the surface. Bake the cake for 35 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.  Make the frosting before the cake cools.  Making the Frosting Mix the cola, cocoa, and margarine or butter in a pan and bring to a boil.  Add the vanilla and powdered sugar.  Mix until smooth.  Spread the warm frosting on the cake.  Sprinkle chopped nuts over cake, if desired. Once the frosting has set, the cake is ready to serve.
